observations: There are two grids, an input and an output.
Input grid has a column of 0s.
The output grid removes the column of 0s.
The last columns of the input become the first columns of the output.
The output grid is formed by taking the rightmost columns from the input.
hypotheses: Remove the column of zeros and right-justify the remaining columns.
Remove the zero column, shift the rightmost columns to the left, padding with the original leftmost columns.
Remove the zero column, and copy the rightmost columns into the output.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: Remove the zero column, shift the rightmost columns to the left, padding with the original leftmost columns.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: This hypothesis fails in the first example because the initial leftmost columns are not copied into the remaining spaces.

selected_rule: Remove the column of zeros and then extract the rightmost columns of the input to form the output grid.
step_plan: Locate the column of zeros in the input grid.
Form the output grid using the rightmost columns from the modified input grid.
